results.title: Stock Market News Today, 2/3/26 – U.S. Stock Futures Rise on U.S-India Trade Deal Optimism, Tech Earnings - TipRanks
results.content:
There are no key economic reports scheduled for today.

Notably, the U.S. 10-year Treasury yield was up, floating near 4.28%. WTI crude oil futures were trending lower, hovering near $62.01 per barrel as of the last check. Additionally, the Gold Spot U.S. dollar price decreased to nearly $4,932 per ounce on Tuesday.

Elsewhere, European indexes opened higher today, as a rebound in precious metals lifted mining stocks.

## Asia-Pacific Markets Trade Higher

Asia-Pacific markets traded mostly higher on February 3 following news of the U.S.-India trade deal.

Hong Kong’s Hang Seng Index gained 0.22%. In China, the Shanghai Composite added 1.29%, while the Shenzhen Component rose 2.80%. Meanwhile, Japan’s Nikkei climbed 3.92%, and the Topix surged 3.10%. [...] ### Claim 50% Off TipRanks Premium

 Unlock  hedge fund-level data  and  powerful investing tools  for smarter, sharper decisions
 Stay ahead of the market with  the latest news and analysis  and maximize your portfolio's potential

During Monday’s regular trading, the three major indexes closed higher, after U.S. President Donald Trump announced a trade deal with Indian Prime Minister Narendra Modi. The DJIA climbed 1.05%, the S&P 500 rose 0.54%, and the Nasdaq Composite gained 0.56%.

Under the deal, India will stop buying oil from Russia and instead buy more from the U.S. and Venezuela. In return, the U.S. is reducing tariffs on Indian goods to 18%. [...] About TipRanks

# Stock Market News Today, 2/3/26 – U.S. Stock Futures Rise on U.S-India Trade Deal Optimism, Tech Earnings

Sheryl Sheth

U.S. stock futures rose early Tuesday amid optimism over a U.S.-India trade deal and solid tech earnings. Futures on the Nasdaq 100 (NDX), the S&P 500 (SPX), and the Dow Jones Industrial Average (DJIA) were up 0.54%, 0.26%, and 0.07%, respectively, at 3:53 a.m. EST on February 3.

Emily Thompson

Passionate about the intersection of technology and user experience, Emily explores the latest innovations in augmented reality and their impact on our daily lives.

Find and win [...] > Snap announced Specs Inc. on January 28, 2026; impact: separate brand and capital flexibility.
>
> Specs Inc. will concentrate on Specs hardware and software; impact: clearer product roadmap.
>
> Snap says public Specs availability is planned later in 2026; impact: intensified competition with Meta and Apple.

## Why Snap’s Specs Inc. move matters for wearables buyers in 2026 [...] Shock hit AR fans in 2026. Snap announced on January 28, 2026 that it has established a wholly owned subsidiary, Specs Inc., to run its augmented‑reality glasses program as a separate business. The move promises “greater operational focus and alignment,” plus new partnership and capital options that could include minority investment before a public launch later this year. That fact makes Specs not just another product line but a bet on a distinct hardware brand. Will Snap’s split speed AR adoption or just invite deeper competition?

## What changes now for AR buyers after Specs Inc.’s 2026 spin-off
